alert.note: Alert for Sullivan; Vigo (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 30 at 10:32PM EST until February 07 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Indiana... Illinois... Wabash River from Lafayette to Vincennes. .Lowland flooding continues along the Wabash River from Lafayette to Riverton, and will arrive at Vincennes Wednesday morning. The crest is currently near Clinton. Flooding is expected to continue along the lower Wabash at Riverton and Vincennes well into next week. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY, FEBRUARY 07... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Terre Haute. * WHEN...Until Wednesday, February 07. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Pottsville Street just northwest of Terre Haute is flooded. Lowland flooding in progress with several river roads flooded in Clark County Illinois. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM EST Tuesday /8:30 PM CST Tuesday/ the stage was 21.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 PM EST Tuesday /8:30 PM CST Tuesday/ was 21.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.2 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday, February 06. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued Wednesday afternoon by around 145 PM EST /1245 PM CST/.
